product_overview: VibeDev ID is a vibrant Indonesian developer community platform designed to showcase projects, foster community engagement, and promote AI-assisted coding practices. It offers an easy-to-use interface for developers to create profiles, submit projects, interact through likes and comments, and track analytics, all optimized for SEO and tailored to Indonesian developer audiences.
core_goals: Provide a secure, seamless authentication system with email and OAuth options and email domain whitelist enforcement.
Enable comprehensive user profiles with avatar management and social integration.
Offer a robust project showcase platform featuring SEO-friendly URLs, filtering, and detailed views with engagement tracking.
Implement interactive engagement features including likes, comments, and views to foster community interaction.
Deliver an admin panel for managing homepage video showcases with YouTube metadata integration.
Utilize modern web technologies ensuring high performance, responsiveness, and excellent SEO.
Maintain strict security and privacy standards including row level security, session management, and bot filtering in analytics.
key_features: Email and OAuth authentication with email confirmation and whitelist filtering.
User profiles with unique usernames, avatar uploads, social links, and bio editing.
Project submission with SEO-friendly slugs, categories, image uploads, and favicon auto-fetching.
Engagement system featuring likes per user, comments supporting anonymous guest commenters, and detailed view tracking with session-based unique counts and bot filtering.
Admin YouTube video manager with CRUD operations and YouTube metadata scraping.
Light/dark mode theme management and responsive UI implemented using Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui component library.
Comprehensive SEO setup including metadata, structured data, and clean URL routing for profiles and projects.
Session management middleware ensuring secure access control and email verification enforcement.
user_flow_summary: User signs up via email with domain whitelist or alternate OAuth providers (Google, GitHub).
User confirms email (if using email/password) and signs in to the platform.
User creates or edits profile: username is auto-generated with collision handling, avatar uploaded via UploadThing, and social links added.
User submits a new project, provides details and image, and system creates a unique slug with automatic favicon fetch.
Users browse projects with sorting and filtering options; project detail pages show likes, comments, views, and author info.
Users can like projects once, comment either authenticated or as guests with optional names, and contribute to view count which is tracked uniquely per session.
Admins manage homepage videos through the dedicated admin dashboard using the YouTube metadata API.
User accesses protected routes guarded by middleware enforcing authentication and email confirmation status.
validation_criteria: Successful user authentication with email domain whitelist enforcement and OAuth sign-in.
Correct creation, update, and display of user profiles including unique username generation and avatar management.
Project CRUD operations operate correctly with proper slug generation, favicon fetching, and access controls for ownership.
Likes can be toggled per user per project with accurate count display and UI feedback.
Comments are stored and retrieved with proper author attribution for authenticated and guest users.
View counts increment correctly with session deduplication and exclude bots/crawlers based on user agent filtering.
Admin video management API correctly performs CRUD operations and fetches correct YouTube metadata.
SEO metadata and structured data present on pages meet standards and support indexing.
Application performance meets Core Web Vitals targets (LCP < 2.5s, FID < 100ms, CLS < 0.1).
Security policies, including row level security and middleware session checks, are enforced consistently.
